member.name: T:Avalonia.Animation.CompositePageTransition
member.summary: Defines a composite page transition that can be used to combine multiple transitions.

remarks.para:
Instantiate the in XAML and initialize the property in order to have many animations triggered at once. For example, you can combine and .
<reactiveUi:RoutedViewHost Router="{Binding Router}"> <reactiveUi:RoutedViewHost.PageTransition> <CompositePageTransition> <PageSlide Duration="0.5" /> <CrossFade Duration="0.5" /> </CompositePageTransition> </reactiveUi:RoutedViewHost.PageTransition> </reactiveUi:RoutedViewHost>

member.summary: Converts a brush to an immutable brush.
member.returns: The result of calling if the brush is mutable, otherwise .

member.summary: Converts a dash style to an immutable dash style.
member.returns: The result of calling if the style is mutable, otherwise .

member.summary: Converts a pen to an immutable pen.
member.returns: The result of calling if the brush is mutable, otherwise .

member.name: T:Avalonia.Media.CharacterHit
member.summary: Represents information about a character hit within a glyph run.
member.remarks: The CharacterHit structure provides information about the index of the first character that got hit as well as information about leading or trailing edge.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Media.CharacterHit.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure.
member.param: Index of the first character that got hit.
In the case of a leading edge, this value is 0. In the case of a trailing edge, this value is the number of code points until the next valid caret position.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Media.CharacterHit.FirstCharacterIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of the first character that got hit.

member.name: P:Avalonia.Media.CharacterHit.TrailingLength
member.summary: Gets the trailing length value for the character that got hit.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.GeometryCombineMode.Union
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the union of both. The resulting geometry is geometry A + geometry B.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.GeometryCombineMode.Intersect
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking their intersection. The new area consists of the overlapping region between the two geometries.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.GeometryCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the area that exists in the first region but not the second and the area that exists in the second region but not the first. The new region consists of (A-B) + (B-A), where A and B are geometries.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.GeometryCombineMode.Exclude
member.summary: The second region is excluded from the first. Given two geometries, A and B, the area of geometry B is removed from the area of geometry A, producing a region that is A-B.

member.summary: Draws a rectangle with the specified Brush and Pen.
member.param: The brush used to fill the rectangle, or null for no fill.
The pen used to stroke the rectangle, or null for no stroke.
The radius in the X dimension of the rounded corners. This value will be clamped to the range of 0 to Width/2
The radius in the Y dimension of the rounded corners. This value will be clamped to the range of 0 to Height/2
member.remarks: The brush and the pen can both be null. If the brush is null, then no fill is performed. If the pen is null, then no stoke is performed. If both the pen and the brush are null, then the drawing is not visible.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Media.PreciseEllipticArcHelper.EllipticalArc
member.summary:
This class represents an elliptical arc on a 2D plane.
This class is adapted for use with WPF StreamGeometryContext, and needs to be created explicitly for each particular arc.
Some helpers
It can handle ellipses which are not aligned with the x and y reference axes of the plane, as well as their parts.
Another improvement is that this class can handle degenerated cases like for example very flat ellipses(semi-minor axis much smaller than semi-major axis) and drawing of very small parts of such ellipses at very high magnification scales.This imply monitoring the drawing approximation error for extremely small values.Such cases occur for example while drawing orbits of comets near the perihelion.
When the arc does not cover the complete ellipse, the lines joining the center of the ellipse to the endpoints can optionally be included or not in the outline, hence allowing to use it for pie-charts rendering. If these lines are not included, the curve is not naturally closed.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.PreciseEllipticArcHelper.EllipticalArc.Coeffs2Low
member.summary: Coefficients for error estimation while using quadratic Bezier curves for approximation, 0 b/a 0.25

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.PreciseEllipticArcHelper.EllipticalArc.Coeffs2High
member.summary: Coefficients for error estimation while using quadratic Bezier curves for approximation, 0.25 b/a 1

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.PreciseEllipticArcHelper.EllipticalArc.Safety2
member.summary: Safety factor to convert the "best" error approximation into a "max bound" error

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.PreciseEllipticArcHelper.EllipticalArc.Coeffs3Low
member.summary: Coefficients for error estimation while using cubic Bezier curves for approximation, 0.25 b/a 1

member.summary: Coefficients for error estimation while using cubic Bezier curves for approximation, 0.25 b/a 1

member.summary: Safety factor to convert the "best" error approximation into a "max bound" error

member.name: T:Avalonia.Media.Stretch
member.summary: Describes how content is resized to fill its allocated space.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.Stretch.None
member.summary: The content preserves its original size.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.Stretch.Fill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.Stretch.Uniform
member.summary: The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while preserving its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.Stretch.UniformToFill
member.summary: The content is resized to completely fill the destination rectangle while preserving its native aspect ratio. A portion of the content may not be visible if the aspect ratio of the content does not match the aspect ratio of the allocated space.

member.name: T:Avalonia.Media.StretchDirection
member.summary: Describes the type of scaling that can be used when scaling content.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.StretchDirection.UpOnly
member.summary: Only scales the content upwards when the content is smaller than the available space. If the content is larger, no scaling downwards is done.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.StretchDirection.DownOnly
member.summary: Only scales the content downwards when the content is larger than the available space. If the content is smaller, no scaling upwards is done.

member.name: F:Avalonia.Media.StretchDirection.Both
member.summary: Always stretches to fit the available space according to the stretch mode.

member.summary: Specifies that arcs are drawn in a clockwise (positive-angle) direction.

member.summary: Draws a rectangle with the specified Brush and Pen.
member.param: The brush used to fill the rectangle, or null for no fill.
The pen used to stroke the rectangle, or null for no stroke.
member.remarks: The brush and the pen can both be null. If the brush is null, then no fill is performed. If the pen is null, then no stoke is performed. If both the pen and the brush are null, then the drawing is not visible.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Platform.IDrawingContextImpl.CreateLayer(Avalonia.Size)
member.summary: Creates a new that can be used as a render layer for the current render target.
member.param: The size of the layer in DIPs.
member.remarks: Depending on the rendering backend used, a layer created via this method may be more performant than a standard render target bitmap. In particular the Direct2D backend has to do a format conversion each time a standard render target bitmap is rendered, but a layer created via this method has no such overhead.

member.summary: Tracks dirty rectangles.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Rendering.DirtyRects.Add(Avalonia.Rect)
member.summary: Adds a dirty rectangle, extending an existing dirty rectangle if it intersects.
member.remarks: We probably want to do this more intelligently because: - Adding e.g. the top left quarter of a scene and the bottom left quarter of a scene will cause the whole scene to be invalidated if they overlap by a single pixel - Adding two adjacent rectangles that don't overlap will not cause them to be coalesced - It only coalesces the first intersecting rectangle found - one needs to call at the end of the draw cycle to coalesce the rest.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Rendering.SceneGraph.DeferredDrawingContextImpl.TrimChildren
member.summary: Removes any remaining drawing operations from the visual node.
member.remarks: Drawing operations are updated in place, overwriting existing drawing operations if they are different. Once drawing has completed for the current visual node, it is possible that there are stale drawing operations at the end of the list. This method trims these stale drawing operations.

member.name: T:Avalonia.VisualTree.IVisual
member.summary: Represents control that has a visual on-screen representation.
member.remarks: The interface defines the interface required for a renderer to render a control. You should not usually need to reference this interface unless you are writing a renderer; instead use the extension methods defined in to traverse the visual tree. This interface is implemented by . It should not be necessary to implement it anywhere else.
